title: [Rails] Re: RoR - Complicated default value for a text_area
content:
Hassan Schroeder wrote in post #1177877: > On Wed, Aug 19, 2015 at 5:19 AM, Quake Live > wrote: > >> My idea was to convert the String to an Array and print each element of >> the Array. But it did not work. Here is what it is looking like: >> >> <%= f.text_area :number, :value => s.some_string.nil? "" : >> s.some_string.split(',').each %> > > Your first problem is using `puts` in a view; `puts` writes to stdout - > you want the values rendered in the web page. > > Second problem is that a newline is just a whitespace character in > HTML; you probably want something like > > s.some_string.split(',').join(",
").html_safe > > HTH, > -- > Hassan Schroeder ------------------------ hassan.schroeder@gmail.com > http://about.me/hassanschroeder > twitter: @hassan > Consulting Availability : Silicon Valley or remote Sorry that I am answering that late.
